summary: Create a congratulatory website for a friend who became a pilot at Air India Express, themed in orange, red, and white.
architectural_notes: Deployment domain/slug must be 5–50 characters and contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens (no spaces/parentheses).
known_issues: Production deployment failed due to invalid domain name/slug containing disallowed characters (spaces/parentheses), triggering a deployment error.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive, single-page congratulatory website for a friend who was selected as a pilot at Air India Express and will be flying a Boeing 737, with clear celebratory copy and sections that work well on mobile and desktop.
Apply a consistent visual theme using an orange, red, and white palette (Air India Express-inspired) across the entire site, including typography, buttons/links, and section styling.
Add generated static image assets (saved under frontend/public/assets/generated) and use them on the homepage (e.g., hero and decorative elements) to reinforce the pilot/aviation celebration theme.
Add a new aircraft photo asset and display it on the congratulatory page as a dedicated, responsive section (with a short caption) so the site includes a clear visual of the aircraft.

Add interactive tap/click pop-ups (modal dialogs) so that when the user taps specific celebratory elements on the page, a pop-up opens showing a Boeing 737 visual/photo and a congratulatory/cute message for Vivan Pathak.
Add a small, clearly labeled interaction cue so visitors know they can tap/click (e.g., “Tap a card for a surprise message”) and keep the copy in English.
Increase the prominence of the tap/click interaction cue in the Highlights section so it is immediately noticeable on both mobile and desktop (not subtle, not easy to miss).

Make each highlight card itself communicate “tap/click me” more clearly by adding an always-visible visual affordance on the cards (not only visible on hover), while keeping the existing layout, copy, and modal behavior intact.
Add the user-uploaded photo (IMG_0098.jpeg) to the app as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/ (optimized for web) so it can be used in the hero/top section.

Update the top of the page (HeroSection) to show Vivan Pathak’s photo first/at the beginning as the primary congratulatory visual, while keeping the existing Air India Express-inspired theme and ensuring the layout remains responsive on mobile and desktop.

Remove the portrait photo of Vivan Pathak from the top Hero section so the page no longer displays the image currently rendered from `/assets/generated/vivan-hero.dim_1200x1500.jpg`, and adjust the Hero layout to remain visually balanced and responsive on mobile and desktop without the photo.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a congratulatory website for a friend selected as a pilot at Air India Express (Boeing 737), using an orange/red/white theme.
Add a photo of the friend’s aircraft to the live congratulatory site.
Include the friend’s name (Vivan Pathak) in the website copy/message.
Add interactive tap/click pop-ups (modals) showing Boeing 737 visuals/photos plus congratulatory/cute messages.
Make the tap/click interaction cue much more prominent/visible so users notice they can tap for pop-ups.

projectName: Congratulatory pilot website (Air India Express-themed colors)
